title.narrative: Building the capacity to implement Industry 4.0 in Viet Nam

description.narrative:
The overall purpose of the intended project is to assist the Government of Viet Nam (GoV) to build the capacity to prepare for Industry 4.0. This will include preparation of the manufacturing sector (micro) as well as its macro and meso level support institutions. Preparation involves the country’s own adoption of Industry 4.0 and its ability to react and act on implementation of Industry 4.0 globally. Suitable manufacturing sectors for capacity building will be identified during the fact-finding mission. Moreover, the intended project purports to identify the new required worker profile and address the need for re-training and re-skilling of workers, as well as provision of relevant training, in identified manufacturing sectors.
The One Strategy Plan 2017 – 2021 indicates that “Viet Nam is currently experiencing a demographic dividend, with twice as many people of working age than dependents. This provides a large supply of labour for economic development. With a gradual shift from exports of raw agricultural products (such as rice, coffee, pepper and seafood) and labour-intensive manufacturing (in clothing and footwear) to increasingly diversified and more sophisticated goods (such as mobile phones and computers), Viet Nam’s integration into global production networks has been instrumental in generating jobs and employment for low- and semi-skilled workers. However, given the prevalence of low value-added production, there is a risk that Viet Nam may fall into what some economists refer to as the “middle-income trap”. The proposed project on Industry 4.0 is mindful of this and one of its main aims is to prevent this, inter alia through actions such as enhancing industry’s preparedness, particularly in relation to skills development.
In the longer-term, addressing workforce enhancement for adoption of Industry 4.0 is expected to improve manufacturing productivity and competitiveness, which in turn would contribute to employment generation and economic growth.
The project will utilize Industry 4.0 instruments and tools developed by the Department of Trade, Investment and Innovation (TII) in the course of its work in India as well as leverage on other work in the region such as the Cambodia workshop on I4.0 in June, 2018.
